nameEntry.part: Out of Home Preventative and Alternative Care Planning and Coordination Committee

biogHist.abstract: The Out of Home Preventative and Alternative Care Planning and Coordination Committee was established by the Western Australian government in September 1994. Its role was to advise the Director-General of the Department responsible for child welfare on how services in the out-of-home 'care' sector could be integrated and enhanced.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Consultative Committee on Residential Child Care [and Interim Committee] (1977 - 1993)
Department for Community Development, State of Western Australia (1992 - 1995)

descriptiveNote.p: The Out of Home Preventative and Alternative Care Planning and Coordination Committee advised the Department for Community Development on the development and integration of the out of home care sector in Western Australia.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Department for Family and Children's Services, State of Western Australia (1995 - 2001)

descriptiveNote.p: The Out of Home Preventative and Alternative Care Planning and Coordination Committee advised the Department for Family and Children's Services on the development and integration of the out of home care sector in Western Australia.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Out of Home Preventative and Alternative Care Planning and Coordination Committee', in Find & Connect - Western Australia,

bibref.title: Out of Home Preventative and Alternative Care Planning and Coordination Committee

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Consultative and advisory committees on residential care for children 1977 to 2003

archref.repository: Dr Debra Rosser, Blair Fox Pty Ltd, unpublished manuscript
archref.unittitle: Consultative and advisory committees on residential care for children 1977 to 2003
archref.abstract: 'Consultative and advisory committees on residential care for children 1977 to 2003' is a copy of an unpublished manuscript prepared by Dr Debra Rosser in 2004. It gives an overview of a number of consultative and advisory committees established to inform the Minister and Departments responsible for child welfare in Western Australia. Committees named in the document are the Interim Committee on Residential Child Care (1977-1980); the Consultative Committee on Residential Child Care (1981-1990); the Consultative Committee on Out of Home Care (1991-1993); the Out of Home Preventative and Alternative Care Planning and Coordination Committee (1994-1998); the Care for Children Advisory Committee (1999-2002); and the Children and Young People in Care Advisory Committee (2003).
